intro: Cordylostigma cicendioides, commonly known as the golden star lily, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes orchids, and is characterized by its striking yellow petals and sepals that resemble a star. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a rhizomatous root system. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a fragrant nectar that attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
